nested.help:
Issue the request as a domain administrator
If set to`Yes`, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.

parameters.help: Leave the field empty to display all files. Enter the filename or its part(s).
parameters.name: spreadsheetName
parameters.label: Filename Keywords

nested.help:
Must have **domain administrator** access.
If set to `Yes`, all shared drives will be searched for results.
nested.name: useDomainAdminAccess
nested.label: Use Domain Admin Access

nested.help:
Find the Spreadsheet ID by clicking **ID Finder** .
e.g. 1a1ADVruoa0YztkOpKM6BWXIYO9GWaA
nested.name: spreadsheetId
nested.label: Spreadsheet ID

nested.help: Please select the column range you want to work with.
nested.name: tableFirstRow
nested.label: Column range

nested.help:
A spreadsheet ID can be extracted from its URL.
For example, the spreadsheet ID in the URL `https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/abc1234567/edit#gid=0` is `abc1234567`
nested.name: spreadsheetId
nested.label: Spreadsheet ID

nested.help: Please select the column range you want to work with.
nested.name: tableFirstRow
nested.label: Column range

store.help: Whether to insert a row unformatted. This e.g. means that if you try to add new URLs into a column in Google Sheets, they will not be converted to clickable links if you select `Yes` here.
store.name: insertUnformatted
store.label: Unformatted

store.help: The way the input data will be interpreted. More detailed explanations can be found in the [Make Help Center](https://www.make.com/en/help/app/google-sheets#add-a-row-964718).
store.name: valueInputOption
store.label: Value input option

store.help: The way existing data is changed when new data is input. More detailed explanations can be found in the [Make Help Center](https://www.make.com/en/help/app/google-sheets#add-a-row-964718).
store.name: insertDataOption
store.label: Insert data option

description: Appends a new row to the bottom of the table.
